alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:22PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM CDT... At 322 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Moorefield, or 14 miles northeast of Curtis, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Lincoln County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Nebraska.
